Key Match Events: Giannis Antetokounmpo was called for a foul on LaMelo Ball with 7.3 seconds remaining, leading to two free throws for Ball.
LaMelo Ball hit a floater over Taurean Prince and was awarded a free throw after Prince was called for a foul.
Pat Connaughton laid in a basket to give the Bucks a one-point lead with nineteen seconds left.
LaMelo Ball nailed both free throws after the foul call on Giannis, leading to a Bucks loss after Giannis missed a game-winning jumper.
Post-Match Reflections: Doc Rivers expressed frustration with the officiating and the replay system, stating 'You can’t guess at the end of a game.'
Crew chief Curtis Blair admitted postgame that there was no illegal contact on the play involving Giannis and LaMelo Ball.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The article discusses the flaws in the NBA's replay and challenge system, suggesting changes similar to the NFL's rules for replay review within the game's final two minutes.
